intro: Trichanthera modesta, commonly known as the small-flowered trichanthera, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30-60 centimeters and features narrow, linear leaves arranged alternately along the stem. Its small, yellow flowers are clustered in dense, disc-like inflorescences, and it is often found in open grasslands and disturbed soils. Trichanthera modesta is noted for its adaptability to various environmental conditions and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
